reviews.text: This was our first stay at the Quality Inn in Gananoque. Had a fireplace/jacuzzi suite. Room was pristine on arrival and larger than any other rooms we have seen in Gananoque.
reviews.title: Best place to stay in Gananoque
Good value
reviews.text: Staff were courteous and professional. The included full breakfast was a nice alternative to the usual "continental" breakfast.

reviews.title: Great Hotel in a Super Location
reviews.text: We have already re-booked a room for this February!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently stayed at the Quality Inn & Suites in one of their large jacuzzi rooms. The room was a good size with a lovely large jacuzzi tub and so clean. The room felt so romantic. We also were given a coupon for a free breakfast in the lobster trap restaurant. The breakfast was excellent. We would like to commend the front desk clerk for being so friendly and helpful. Thank you for a wonderful stay, we can't wait to return again.
reviews.title: Great Hotel and Wonderful Staff

likes.disliked: — I was happy with all of my stay

reviews.title: Not Great Value
reviews.text: Not a great value at the Quality Inn. Stayed the first night of a reservation. Was dissapointed with the friendliness of the staff and the cleanliness of the rooms. Went to the Best Western for the second night and was very impressed. The value at the Best Western far exceeds that of the Quality Inn.

reviews.title: Great Breakfast
reviews.text: I was pleased with everything at this motel: a two-queen room is large, clean, comfortable and with a quality bathroom, AND relatively cheap. I'll keep returning for the breakfast though - their lobster-themed restaurant provides a full hot breakfast included with the stay: juice, choice of five breakfast meals (like pancakes, french toast, eggs & bacon, fruit plate) and coffee or milk. All this was under 70 $CAN, and I figure we ate at least $25 worth of food for the three of us.
It's very close to the casino, which isn't relevant to us other than there seems to be a lot of drunken people returning to their rooms very late at night, even in the off-season.
reviews.title: Some really nice place!

reviews.text: We got to Gananoque very late. all the motels and hotels were full.
reviews.title: Nice place to stay
would stay again
reviews.text: Good clean, quiet room. Staff at desk and dining room were great. Room included a free full breakfast in their dining room, breakfast arrived in about 3 minutes flat. Got a 5 buck discount for supper and a deal for some casino tokens to boot. We paid $89 for two queen sized beds. Parking was two steps from the door. Coffee and fridge in room.

The hotel is laid out in blocks consisting of the reception, with a restaurant nextdoor, then three accomodation buildings with outside entrances to the rooms. We arrived tired after a long drive from Quebec City and were glad of the speedy checkin. The receptionist was friendly and helpful. We had booked a jaccuzi room, which was large and clean. Our towels were folded in the shape of a dog, which we found rather cute. If we had a complaint, it would be that our room was right behind the lobster retaurant, which meant we had the greasy smell from the kitchen exhaust, so I would suggest asking for a room away from the kitchen. We didn't have chance to check out the pool, but children were swimming happily and we met a woman who had been here for a week, and she had no complaints, but overall, I would rate this hotel as a good place for a stopover or as a reasonably priced (for the area) place to stay with children, but not one where I would base an entire vacation.
reviews.title: Good stopover
Would stay again!
reviews.text: Really enjoyed our stay. The room was clean, the service great. It was nice to have breakfast in a restaurant instead of the typical continental breakfast. The room service folded our jacuzzi towels in the shape of swans--which was a nice touch! A good choice for a decent price.

reviews.title: A reasonable place to stay
reviews.text: We stayed one night at the Quality Inn and Suites on our way from Toronto to Ottawa as we wanted to take a quick rain check on the 1000 Islands area. It is a beautiful area and worth taking time out to explore.

reviews.title: VERY NICE- GOOD LOCATION
reviews.text: The hotel was standard motel fodder - it is situated on the outskirts of town right next door to a McDonalds and comprises three seperate blocks.

Very typical of most other Choice Hotels in that it is old, smells, furniture and bed are worn out, and relatively dirty. No surprises good or bad if you frequent this chain. Personally I dislike them, though admittedly I am a bit fussier than most. Spend the extra money and stay at the new Holiday Inn Express down the street.
reviews.title: Typical of Choice Hotels

reviews.text: My family went to the Quality inn on 07/27/07 at 9pm after a long drive from New York we checked into a lovely room and went to the Lobster Trap which is part of the motel for dinner.My kids were hungry and the time was 9:15 and the restaurants close at 10pm When the waitress named Rachell sat us down she asked me when are you expecting? I said pardon....She said your baby.. I was shocked and asked her maybe its my top that makes me look that way. Her reply was " No the way you were standing and your side view makes you look pregnant!! and she made a ball motion on her stomache. Well If it wasnt for the fact my kids were hungry and tired I would have left as I thought I would bring this matter to the manager in the morning, and to make the situation worse Rachell went to other tables and laughed and said woops I thought that lady was pregnant.When she came back to take our order I said after that comment I dont think I should eat and bring me a drink she said I dont blame you I would feel like that too and I'll make the drink myself and I will make it strong. I did after all order food but had to leave it with my self esteem behind.That evening I went to the front desk and said what had took place and the gentelman their said to leave my name and number as the manager from the Lobster Trap would call me. In the morning the manager called and said she was sorry and would send me something in the mail.Well after all that I thought the manager of the hotel should know and called him and his reply was What do you want? and went on to tell me about Rachels bad childhood and that she couldnt afford to have a vacation. That was an unacceptable responce from what I thought was the manager but Jeff corrected me and said he was the owner!! His main concern was that as he put it was opening up his wallet' When all I wanted was my night back with my family as we worked hard to have that vacation. We missed the complimentary breakfast and I couldnt swallow dinner and as for sleep well who could sleep with being told and laughed at about their weight. What Jeff thought was an attempt to go into his check book was only some compinsation for me as a human being to have a decent night out with my family again. He even told me on the phone to forget it as he thinks thats all Iam after and said in so many words if i write this review he would put in comments of his own and told me to get a lawyer as he has a whole team of lawyers. Well Jeff I wrote this as I never want anyone to go through a vacation like mine and I thought the public so know.
reviews.title: An abusive waitress that gets support from the owner

likes.disliked: — The hotel owner Jeff as he promotes abusive behavior

reviews.text: We stayed over the weekend of July 27 and had a great experience.
reviews.title: Great Place to stay !!!!

reviews.text: Gananoque is such a pleasant small town with lots to see and do. The staff at the front desk of the Quality Inn were very helpful in making recommendations and answering our many questions.
reviews.title: Problems with front desk

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were 3 couples staying overnight for a getaway without the kids. The room and pool were clean (although the pool is not heated, as advertised). It's in a great location, close to many restaurants and the casino. Our problems arose when we returned to the hotel after dinner and found a very intoxicated stranger in one of our rooms! It seems that this man was given his room number and key but went to the wrong room. When his key didn't work, he returned to the front desk and informed them that the key to room 262 didn't work. Without checking his name or other vital information, they reprogrammed his key to room 262 - our room. This would be a major security concern, especially if you are travelling alone. The hotel manager refused to change the room but said they would clean it. That was it!
reviews.title: Oasis after a long drive
